Patrick,

How very topical!!!  Your tsuba is NAMBAN.  I'm sure others will give more info, but these have been discussed somewhat on this list of late.  If you would care to reply to me offline I'll give you a little more info.  Can you put up a better pic that is better exposed to show more of the detail in the work, and preferably both sides of the tsuba.

Regards,

Barry Thomas.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Patrick 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, December 06, 2006 11:41 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Tsuba help


  Hello,

  I was hoping to get some help regarding a 'Tsuba' I have. I know
  nothing of them, in fact the only reason I know they are called
  'Tsubas' is because I saw one on television this morning...

  I Googled 'Tsuba' and this group was one of the first links I found. I
  have tried - with difficulty - to identify and date my tsuba.

  So I thought I would seek help from people who know about tsubas and
  Japanese swords.
  Here is a link to a photograph of it:
  http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v340/donuil_dhu/_DSC0031.jpg

  I think it may be bronze. And help I could get with identifying and
  dating it would be briliant! Thanks in advance!

  Patrick

  .
